ecosim.entity

Class GrassTuft

  • java.lang.Object
    • ecosim.entity.Entity
      • ecosim.entity.GrassTuft
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPaintable, IUpdatable

    public class GrassTuft
extends Entity
    A GrassTuft is an edible Grass entity. Wombats will move towards GrassTuft objects and eat them if they are hungry. GrassTufts will only grow on GrassTile objects in a place that is not already taken by another GrassTuft. The EcoSim update method should add a GrassTuft on a random GrassTile that is not already taken every 1000 milliseconds.
    Author:
    Michael

    • Constructor Detail

      • GrassTuft

        public GrassTuft(float x,
                 float y)
        Constructs a Grass tuft at the given x and y location. It will have the default image. Wombats will try to eat this.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of this object's bounds.
        y - the y coordinate of this object's bounds.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(long millisElapsed)
        The update method for GrassTufts does nothing. Maybe it would be more efficient if this was not an IUpdatable object.
        Parameters:
        millisElapsed - the milliseconds that have passed since the last call to this method.

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Description copied from class: Entity
        Paints the object's image to the MainWindow at the location of this object's bounds, with the same size as this object's bounds. If this object is added to the GameEngine, this method will automatically be called 60 times per second.
        Specified by:
        paint in interface IPaintable
        Overrides:
        paint in class Entity
        Parameters:
        g - a graphics context for drawing images, text and primitive shapes to a javax.swing component.
